oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Phillips-Robinson Funeral Home, 2001 December
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Phillips-Robinson Funeral Home, formerly St. John's Episcopal Church, located at 1700 Hadley Avenue in the Historic Old Hickory Village in Old Hickory, Tennessee. The family-owned and operated business moved into the historic church in the 1990s. The foundation is made of rough cut stone blocks. The exterior walls are made of rough cut stone blocks. The roof is gabled with tar shingles. The windows are stained glass, tall and rectangular. The doors are made of wood. Other features include a small bell tower adorned with a cross. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Phillips-Robinson Funeral Home (Old Hickory, Tenn.); St. John's Episcopal Church (Old Hickory, Tenn.)
